title: The Three Ages of Man
medium: pen, brush and bister ink, bister and grey washes
credit_line: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff
provenance_text:
Jean-Baptiste Greuze [1725-1805], Paris, France. Baron Roger Portalis [1841-1912], Paris, France (Lugt 2232) [1]; likely sold at the Portalis sale, Hotel Drouot, Paris France, March 14, 1887 [1]. Seiferheld & Company, New York, NY [3]. Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Fishkoff, Colonia, NJ, likely by June 1974 until December 1975 [4]; their gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1975.
  

[1]. Baron Roger Portalis' collection mark is stamped twice on the drawing (recto, lower right and lower left.)
[2]. The Portalis collection was dispersed in several sales during his lifetime and in one by his estate in 1913. The present drawing was likely sold at the 1887 sale, entitled "Dessins Anciens ....Formant La Collection de M. Le Baron R. P."  Lot 114, by Greuze, is recorded as "Les Trois Ages de la Vie," A la plume et au lavis.
[3]. The gallery, specializing in old master drawings, was active throughout the 1960s under various names. Several other works in the Fishkoff collection have also passed through this NYC gallery.
[4]. The drawing was received at the museum on December 4, 1975.

creator.death_place: Paris (Ville de Paris department, Île-de-France, France)
